headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Jenna Ellis Pleads Guilty. Aired 9:30-10a ET

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right. Yes, just to review here. And, actually, there was another plea deal by Scott Hall early on, one of the lesser-known defends.

utterances.speaker: VALENCIA
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: But last week it was Sidney Powell and Kenneth Chesebro. And what we're waiting on now, and what Nick Valencia has exclusively from inside the Fulton County Courthouse is it appears that Jenna Ellis now, this Trump campaign lawyer, is in the process of entering into this plea deal.What's different here, Nick, and I'll circle her with red so to indicate it's a little different than the others right now, is she did not have a trial date looming. Chesebro and Powell, their trials were supposed to begin basically jury selection this week. Jenna Ellis sometime in the distance. Do we have any reporting on what may have pushed her to this moment today?

utterances.speaker: VALENCIA
utterances.sentences: We don't. You know, we've repeatedly been calling her attorney because we heard whispers that this was potentially - these discussions were potentially in the works with the district attorney's office after Sidney Powell and Ken Chesebro took their deals. We never got comments from her attorney but it appears (INAUDIBLE) -

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Hey, Nick, we're looking inside the courtroom right now. It's all going on.Let's listen.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Minimum and maximum sentence with your attorneys?

utterances.speaker: JENNA ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I have.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And do you understand that that carries a minimum penalty of one year to a maximum penalty of five years to serve?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that you have the right to plead guilty or not guilty to this charge? And if you plead not guilty, you have the right to remain silent and move forward with the jury trial? ELLIS

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Have you reviewed the waiver rights with your attorney?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I have.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And have you gone over that waiver of rights and also signed it, along with your attorneys?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I have.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Have you had enough time to speak with your attorneys in regard to the facts in this case and any defenses that you may have if you were to have gone to trial?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you need any more time to speak with them?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And are you satisfied with their services?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Very much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Hogue, do you waive formal reading of the accusation against your client?FRANK HOGUE, JENNA ELLIS' ATTORNEY: We do.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do we waive any deflects that may lay within the accusation?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: We do.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Ms. Ellis, have you been arrested on these charges?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And it's the state's understanding that there are no other outstanding related warrants to this charge. Do you know of any to your knowledge?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I do not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that this is an negotiated plea, which means the state and your attorneys have reached a recommendation to make to the court?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that the court is not bound by that recommendation and could sentence you to the maximum penalty for this charge? ELLIS

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that if the court does not follow state's recommendations then you can withdrawal your guilty plea and move forward with a jury trial?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that the conditions of this plea involves five years of probation, that you pay $5,000 of restitution to the Georgia Secretary of State within 30 days, and it's my understanding that you're asking to be treated as a first offender?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That you must continue to provide additional recorded statements and affidavits to the state as required. That you must also continue to provide any requested documents or evidence subject to any lawful privileges asserted in good faith, that you shall not post anything on social media, including through any agencies about this case until the conclusion of all trials and appeals, that you must continue to fully cooperate with prosecutors, included but not limited to participating in interviews with prosecutors, appearing for evidentiary hearings, and assisting in pre- trial matters. Do you understand that these are the conditions of the - of the recommendations that the state is making to the court?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It is my understanding that -- have you gone over the first offender status with your attorneys?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I have.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And you are asking this court to be treated as a first offender?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Have you pled guilty or no lo (ph) to ever in this state of Georgia or any other jurisdiction?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: No. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALEfelony or misdemeanor, under the First Offender Act?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And you've gone over the First Offender Act with your attorneys, and do you understand that if you violate the terms of your first offender sentence, or commit a new offense while on first offender probation, you first offender status could be revoked and you could be adjudicated guilty and you could be resentenced up to the maximum sentence for this charge in the accusation?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I understand.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that this guilty plea may be used to enhance sentencing of other -- any other convictions in this jurisdiction, as well as other jurisdictions, including the federal court?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that you are being placed on probation and you cannot violate your probation by committing any other crimes in any governmental unit or any -- or violate any special conditions of your probation?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that if you violate the probation or any special conditions, that you will be subject to revocation for the balance of the sentence?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that you are not allowed to possess any - or use any firearms while you are on probation?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that if you are not a United States citizen, this guilty plea will affect your immigration status and will result in deportation?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I understand.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that there may be other adverse or unfavorable consequences as a result of this guilty plea, just as there would be if you were found guilty at trial. For example, your guilty plea may be used -- may affect your right to vote, your right to hold office, your right to serve as a juror, the right to obtain a passport, the right to receive, possess or transport a firearm, the ability to obtain employment, or your membership for the bar in this state or any other states?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I understand. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALEincluding any mental health defenses, by entering the guilty plea?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you understand that if you went to trial, you would have the right to a trial by jury, to - the right to see, hear and -

utterances.speaker: KATE BOLDUAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: All right, we're listening in to what is happening right now as we speak in a Fulton County, Georgia, courthouse. That is Jenna Ellis with her -- her legal representation on the right. She is one of the people who has been charged in Fulton County, alongside Donald Trump. And what it looks like is it appears that she is planning to plead guilty in the Georgia election subversion case in some sort of plea agreement with the prosecution.Zach Cohen is joining us now. And, Zach, you've got a lot more background on all of this. As we watch this play out, what are you learning and remind folks what they should know about Jenna Ellis.

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: Done (ph)?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you, sir. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALEOn December 3rd of 2020, the defendant did appear before a meeting of a Georgia senate judiciary subcommittee in Fulton County, Georgia, with co-defendants William Rudolph Lewis Giuliani, Ray Sterling Smith III, and other individuals associated with Donald J. Trump for President Incorporated, also known as the Trump campaign. During the subcommittee meeting, Giuliani and Smith, acting as attorneys for the Trump campaign, made the following false statements. One, that at least 96,600 mail-in ballots were counted in the November 3, 2020, presidential election in Georgia despite there being no record of those ballots having being returned to a county election office. Two, that 2,506 felons voted illegally in the November 3, 2020, presidential election in Georgia. Three, that 66,248 underage people illegally registered to vote before their 17th birthday, prior to the November 3, 2020, presidential election in Georgia. Four, that at least 2,423 people voted in the November 3, 2020, presidential election in Georgia who were not listed as registered to vote. Five, that 1,043 people voted in the November 3, 2020, presidential election in Georgia who had illegally registered to vote using a post office box. Six, that 10,315 or more dead people voted in the November 3, 2020, presidential election in Georgia. And, seven, that Fulton County election workers at State Farm Arena ordered a poll watcher and members of the media to leave the tabulation area on the night of November 3, 2020, and continued to operate after ordering everyone to leave. The false statements were within the jurisdiction of the Georgia secretary of state and the Georgia Bureau of Investigation, who were each conducting investigations into allegations of fraud in the November 3, 2020, presidential election in Georgia. Once completed, these and other investigations affirmatively determined that there was no widespread fraud that could have affected the outcome of the 2020 presidential election in Georgia. The false statements were made with reckless disregard of the truth and with conspicuous purpose to avoid learning the truth. The defendant attended and abated Giuliani, Smith in making these false statements by assisting with the execution of the December 3, 2020, senate judiciary committee meeting that was held in Fulton County, Georgia. The false statements were used as part of a plan by the Trump campaign to solicit the Georgia general assembly to disregard the certified results of the presidential election in this state and instead to unlawfully appoint non-elected presidential electors in violation of their oaths to the Georgia constitution and to the United States Constitution. Similarly, false statements and solicitations were made to state legislators in Arizona, Michigan and Pennsylvania, and the defendant was present and assisted with the execution of those meetings. And she was in attendance with Giuliani in Arizona and Michigan and Pennsylvania. That would be the factual basis in which the state would have proceeded on, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All right, anything furtherer from the state, Ms. Young (ph)?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Just that we filed a motion of (INAUDIBLE) under the original indictment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All right, turning to Mr. Hogue.Just a few matters of housekeeping before I let you have the floor if there's anything else you want to add. Would you be requesting automatic sealing on this first defender disposition?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's one of my two notes here to ask the court for you to do that under 428621-B, please.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All right. And was part of this negotiated resolution, is there anything to note here about a behavioral incentive date?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, your honor, that's going to be three years.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Hogue, is that right?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: That's correct, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK.Anything else, Mr. Hogue, that you would like to add?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: Yes. If you could make a note that this is not a crime of moral turpitude, that would assist us in other venues perhaps.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And is that an issue of negotiation between the parties? I know that has differed from resolution to resolution here. So, where are we with that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It is not, Judge. We're going to ask that the same verbiage that has been put on the other dispositions be put on this disposition as well, which I believe it says like the defense and the state have agreed that this is not a crime of moral turpitude.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I think that (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That is correct, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK.All right, then, if that is the joint recommendation, I'll -- that will be part of the global recommendation. Understood, Mr. Hogue?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: Your honor, the only other thing is if the court is inclined to accept the negotiated plea, Ms. Ellis would like to exercise her right of allocution and make a brief statement to the court.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All right. So, I think I would typically have that as part of the record before we finalize everything.So, at this point, Ms. Ellis, you're not required to do so in any way, but if you would like to add anything to the record or address the court, you're certainly willing to do - able to do so, and now would be the appropriate time.

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: Your honor, to - if I may approach, I have it in writing what she is about to say.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I have one - I have one attached to State's Exhibit One. Is that the same -

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes, you have it already.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And so would - would there be - would the intention be that this also would be going into the record as State's Exhibit One, the written form? OK. All right. Thank you, Mr. Hogue.

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Thank you, your honor, for the opportunity to address the court.As an attorney who is also a Christian, I take my responsibilities as a lawyer very seriously, and I endeavor to be a person of sound, morale and ethical character in all of my dealings. In the wake of the 2020 presidential election, I believed that challenging the results on behalf of President Trump should be pursued in a just and legal way. I endeavored to represent my client to the best of my ability. I relied on others, including lawyers with many more years of experience than I, to provide me with true and reliable information, especially since my role involved speaking to the media and to legislatures in various states. What I did not do, but should have done, your honor, was to make sure that the facts the other lawyers alleged to be true were, in fact, true. In the frenetic pace of attempting to race challenges to the elections in several states, including Georgia, I failed to do my due diligence. I believe in and I value election integrity. If I knew then what I know now, I would have declined to represent Donald Trump in these post-election challenges. I look back on this whole experience with deep remorse. For those failures of mine, your honor, I have responsibility already before the Colorado Bar, who censured me, and I now take responsibility before this court and I apologize to the people of Georgia. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And thank you, Ms. Ellis, for sharing that. All too often I don't get to hear the perspective of the accused in these case, and so that's appreciated.

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Thank you, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is there anything else, Mr. Hogue, that you would like to have as part of the record?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: No, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Ms. Ellis, I have a few questions that I have to go over with you.Do you understand the nature of this charge that -- as it's been recused against you?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And you heard the rights that you would waive by going forward with this plea. Do you still wish to waive those rights?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And are you pleading guilty today because you agree that there is a factual basis, as outlined by the state, to support this guilty plea?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Hogue, are you satisfied your client is competent and that this plea is understanding and voluntary and that there is a sufficient, factual basis to support it?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: I am, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Ms. Ellis, do you have a weapons carry license of any kind in this state or any other?

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: I do not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Judge, if I misspoke, I said it should be a $5,000 restitution because the max fine is only $1,000.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. That's right.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I made a mistake.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, no, that was my mistake. So, it is a $5,000 restitution. I didn't hear a fine.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: There is no fine, Judge.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK. Understood.Anything else I need to clarify or may have -- obviously, we will, as I mentioned, go off the language that we were provided subsequent to this hearing. Anything else from the state though?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK. And, Mr. Hogue, anything else we should have on the record? Take your time. HOGUEYour honor, it's our understanding there won't be any travel restrictions as a part of her probation. I want to just make that clear for the record that there's no misunderstanding or dispute about that. She lives out of state.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, understood. This has been - this is sometimes a challenge with out of state residents that we have to have things transition and be moved to the out of state probation office (INAUDIBLE) to accept it as well. And so whatever we can do to facilitate that process, I would like to do. That may mean that if she has a flight today, I don't know if that's going to be possible. But if I could check in with probation, maybe we can get some insight on predictions of what we can do to get this case transferred to Colorado I believe you said it was.

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: No, she lives in Florida.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: In Florida. OK.

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: And we do have flights both this afternoon.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK. Let's - well, let's see what we can do.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So we basically would need a police report or an affidavit as we spoke. I would just need to take information from her, a picture and $100 money order and then we can kind of get the process started. But until Florida states that they can accept her case, she has to stay within Georgia.So, if we have everything we need, we can possibly have her report today at 2:00. But if we don't have the indictment, the affidavit, she might have to stay. (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All right. And when you say - well, we'll sort through this, Mr. Hogue. When you say she - after she reports at 2

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So, they're going to try to get it started with Florida. And then if Florida states that we have everything and they can take it, she possibly can go back to Florida today. But if we don't have everything that we need, and Florida doesn't state that they can take her, then she would have to stay until they give us the go ahead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK. Mr. Hogue, what time's that flight?

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: It's at 1I'd like to ask the court to exercise its authority and allow her to travel today. She's been on bond this entire time. It hasn't been that long. But she's abided by all the conditions (INAUDIBLE) and every - whenever. We had thought perhaps we would have this done yesterday (INAUDIBLE) problem that it is now. UNIDENTIFIED MALE: OK. And any thoughts of the state of including some kind of language allowing some flexibility here on making sure the probation paperwork is in order?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Judge, we don't have any objection. We will stand (INAUDIBLE) and let the court make its decision because Ms. Ellis has complied with everything that state has asked.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK. I certainly am amenable to that and I agree that I don't think a flight from the jurisdiction is an issue here. So, I -- we can follow-up and see if we can find other examples and exactly what and how that needs to look, but we'll work on that after we conclude here.

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All right, anything else. I had already checked in with the state.Last call over to Mr. Hogue.

utterances.speaker: HOGUE
utterances.sentences: We're good. Thank you, your honor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK, thank you, sir.Good luck, Ms. Ellis. And we'll be off the record.

utterances.speaker: ELLIS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right, just a huge moment in a Fulton County, Georgia, courtroom. Jenna Ellis, former Trump campaign attorney, has pleaded guilty to one count of aiding and abetting false statements in writing. This has to o with the hearing that she attended on December 3, 2020, with, importantly -

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Rudy Giuliani. Why is that so important? Because she made a statement. She delivered an elocution inside the courtroom.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Which the judge even said was unusual.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Very unusual. And emotional.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: Due diligence.
